info.description: rest.bitcoin.com is the REST layer for Bitcoin.com's Cloud. More info: [developer.bitcoin.com](https://developer.bitcoin.com). Chatroom [geni.us/CashDev](http://geni.us/CashDev)
info.title: REST

tags.name: rawtransactions
tags.description: Create transactions to be transmitted to the network.

get.description: Returns the details of an address including balance

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address or array of addresses in cashAddr or legacy

400.description: Received an invalid Bitcoin Cash address as input.

schema.message: Received an invalid Bitcoin Cash address as input.

get.description: Returns the list of utxo for an address

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address or an array of addresses in cashAddr or legacy

400.description: Received an invalid Bitcoin Cash address as input.

schema.message: Received an invalid Bitcoin Cash address as input.

get.description: Returns the list of unconfirmed transactions for an address

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address or an array of addresses in cashAddr or legacy

400.description: Received an invalid Bitcoin Cash address as input.

schema.message: Received an invalid Bitcoin Cash address as input.

get.description: Returns the list of transactions for an address

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address in cashAddr or legacy

get.description: Details about a block

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Block hash/height

get.summary: Hash of the best block in the longest blockchain.
get.description: Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest blockchain.

If verbose is false, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for block 'hash'. If verbose is true, returns an Object with information about block hash. The list of transactions hashes can be omitted from the object by setting txs to false

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: the block hash

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: true for a json object, false for the hex encoded data

parameters.name: txs
parameters.description: true to return list of tx hashes, false to omit list of tx hashes

get.description: Returns an object containing various state info regarding blockchain processing.

get.summary: Number of blocks in the longest blockchain.
get.description: Returns the number of blocks in the longest blockchain.

get.summary: Hash of block in best-block-chain at height provided.
get.description: Returns hash of block in best-block-chain at height provided.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: the height index

get.description: If verbose is false, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for blockheader 'hash'. If verbose is true, returns an Object with information about blockheader hash.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: the block hash

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: true for a json object, false for the hex encoded data

get.summary: Information about all known tips in the block tree
get.description: Return information about all known tips in the block tree, including the main chain as well as orphaned branches.
Returns the proof-of-work difficulty as a multiple of the minimum difficulty.
If txid is in the mempool, returns all in-mempool ancestors.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: the transaction id (must be in mempool)

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: True for a json object, false for array of transaction ids

get.description: If txid is in the mempool, returns all in-mempool descendants.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: the transaction id (must be in mempool)

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: True for a json object, false for array of transaction ids

get.description: Returns mempool data for given transaction

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: the transaction id (must be in mempool)

get.summary: The active state of the TX memory pool.
get.description: Returns details on the active state of the TX memory pool.

get.summary: All transaction ids in memory pool.
get.description: Returns all transaction ids in memory pool as a json array of string transaction ids.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: True for a json object, false for array of transaction ids

get.description: Returns details about an unspent transaction output.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: the transaction id

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: vout number

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: Whether to include the mempool

get.description: Returns a hex-encoded proof that 'txid' was included in a block.

parameters.name: txids
parameters.description: a json array of txids to filter [ 'txid' string A transaction hash ,... ]

parameters.name: blockhash
parameters.description: if specified, looks for txid in the block with this hash

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: a string that is a serialized, hex-encoded data for the proof.

get.summary: Verify that a proof points to a transaction in a block
get.description: Verifies that a proof points to a transaction in a block, returning the transaction it commits to and throwing an RPC error if the block is not in our best chain

parameters.name: proof
parameters.description: The hex-encoded proof generated by gettxoutproof

get.description: Returns an object containing various state info.

get.summary: Returns a json object containing mining-related information.

get.description: Returns the estimated network hashes per second based on the last n blocks. Pass in [blocks] to override # of blocks, -1 specifies since last difficulty change. Pass in [height] to estimate the network speed at the time when a certain block was found.

parameters.name: nblocks
parameters.description: the number of blocks, or -1 for blocks since last difficulty change.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: to estimate at the time of the given height.

get.description: Return a JSON object representing the serialized, hex-encoded transaction.

parameters.name: hex
parameters.description: The transaction hex string

get.description: Decode a hex-encoded script.

parameters.name: hex
parameters.description: The hex encoded script

get.description: return the raw transaction data. If verbose is 'true', returns an Object with information about 'txid'. If verbose is 'false' or omitted, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for 'txid'.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction id

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: If false, return a string, otherwise return a json object

post.summary: Submits raw transaction to local node and network.
post.description: Submits raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded) to local node and network. Also see createrawtransaction and signrawtransaction calls.

parameters.name: hex
parameters.description: The hex string of the raw transaction

get.description: Details about a transaction

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: single txid or url encoded array of txids

get.summary: Information about the given bitcoin address.
get.description: Return information about the given bitcoin address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The bitcoin address to validate

post.description: Create a transaction spending the given inputs and creating new outputs. API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/rawTransactions

parameters.name: inputs
parameters.description: A json array of json objects

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.description: A json object with outputs

parameters.name: locktime
parameters.description: Raw locktime. Non-0 value also locktime-activates inputs

post.description: Adds a change output to the transaction.API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/rawTransactions

parameters.name: rawTx
parameters.description: The raw transaction to extend

parameters.name: prevTxs
parameters.description: A JSON array of transaction inputs

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination for the change

parameters.name: fee
parameters.description: The desired transaction fees

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the change output (default: first position)

post.description: Adds a transaction input to the transaction.API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/rawTransactions

parameters.name: rawTx
parameters.description: The raw transaction to extend

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The hash of the input transaction

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The index of the transaction output used as input

post.description: Adds a payload with class C (op-return) encoding to the transaction.API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/rawTransactions

parameters.name: rawTx
parameters.description: The raw transaction to extend

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The hex-encoded payload to add

post.description: Adds a reference output to the transaction. API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/rawTransactions

parameters.name: rawTx
parameters.description: The raw transaction to extend

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The reference address or destination

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The optional reference amount (minimal by default)

get.description: Decodes an Omni transaction. API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/rawTransactions

parameters.name: rawTx
parameters.description: The raw transaction to decode

parameters.name: prevTxs
parameters.description: A JSON array of transaction inputs (default: none)

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The parsing block height (default: 0 for chain height)

parameters.description: The address

parameters.name: propertyId

get.description: Returns a list of all token balances for a given address. API reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/dataRetrieval

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address

get.description: Returns a list of token balances for a given currency or property identifier. API Reference: https://developer.bitcoin.com/wormhole/docs/dataRetrieval

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: The property identifier

get.description: Returns a hash of the balances for the property.

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: The property to hash balances for

400.description: JSON value is not an integer as expected

get.description: Returns a list of blocks containing Omni transactions for use in seed block filtering.

parameters.description: The first block to look for Omni transactions (inclusive)

parameters.description: The last block to look for Omni transactions (inclusive)

400.description: JSON value is not an integer as expected

get.description: Get information and recipients of a send-to-owners transaction.

parameters.description: The hash of the transaction to lookup

parameters.name: recipientFilter
parameters.description: A filter for recipients (wallet by default, '*' for all)

get.description: Get detailed information about an Omni transaction.

parameters.description: The block height or block index

get.description: Returns a list of unconfirmed Omni transactions, pending in the memory pool.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address filter (default: '' for no filter)

get.description: Lists all tokens or smart properties.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: address filter (default: '*')

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: show at most n transactions (default: 10)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip the first n transactions (default: 0)

parameters.name: startBlock
parameters.description: first block to begin the search (default: 0)

parameters.name: endBlock
parameters.description: last block to include in the search (default: 9999999)

post.description: Creates the payload to issue or grant new units of managed tokens.

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the tokens to grant

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of tokens to create

parameters.name: memo
parameters.description: A text note attached to this transaction (none by default)

post.description: Creates the payload for a new tokens issuance with crowdsale.

parameters.name: ecosystem
parameters.description: The ecosystem to create the tokens in, must be 1

parameters.name: propertyPrecision
parameters.description: The precision of the tokens to create:[0, 8]

parameters.name: previousId
parameters.description: An identifier of a predecessor token (0 for new crowdsales)

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A category for the new tokens

parameters.name: subcategory
parameters.description: A subcategory for the new tokens

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new tokens to create

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: An URL for further information about the new tokens

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: A description for the new tokens

parameters.name: propertyIdDesired
parameters.description: The identifier of a token eligible to participate in the crowdsale

parameters.name: tokensPerUnit
parameters.description: The amount of tokens granted per unit invested in the crowdsale

parameters.name: deadline
parameters.description: The deadline of the crowdsale as Unix timestamp

parameters.name: earlyBonus
parameters.description: An early bird bonus for participants in percent per week

parameters.name: undefine
parameters.description: The value must be 0

parameters.name: totalNumber
parameters.description: The number of tokens to create

post.description: Creates the payload for a new tokens issuance with fixed supply.

parameters.name: ecosystem
parameters.description: The ecosystem to create the tokens in, must be 1

parameters.name: propertyPrecision
parameters.description: The precision of the tokens to create:[0, 8]

parameters.name: previousId
parameters.description: An identifier of a predecessor token (use 0 for new tokens)

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A category for the new tokens

parameters.name: subcategory
parameters.description: A subcategory for the new tokens

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new tokens to create

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: An URL for further information about the new tokens

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: A description for the new tokens

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The number of tokens to create

post.description: Creates the payload for a new tokens issuance with manageable supply.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new tokens to create

parameters.name: url

parameters.description: A description for the new tokens

post.description: Creates the payload to issue ERC721 property

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of created property

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The symbol of created property

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The Data of created property
parameters.example: Collect and breed digital Honey Badgers!

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of created property

parameters.name: totalNumber
parameters.description: The number of token that created property will issued in the future

post.description: Creates the payload to issue ERC721 token

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: The ID of the special property that will be issued token

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: The tokenID that will be issued, if you don't want to skip this parament, wormhole system will automatic tokenID

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: The Attributes of the new created token
parameters.example: Collect and breed digital Honey Badgers!

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the new created token

post.description: Creates the payload to transfer ERC721 token

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The ID of the special property that will be issued token

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: The tokenID that will be issued, if you don't want to skip this parament, wormhole system will automatic tokenID

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: The Attributes of the new created token
parameters.example: Collect and breed digital Honey Badgers!

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: The URL of the new created token
